Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the body of a dark-red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the interior is ribbed and spotted with a light-brown granular deposit, the exterior is painted light-orange with remains of a black horizontal band and one line of Coptic text written in black ink, writ large.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394758) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394758)
